primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God invades the human time-sphere through the mystery of infancy to offer a new start and identify with human suffering.

tekstueel_bewijs: God has never given up on the world
God has visited it in Jesus Christ
The eternal had got inside of time
a fresh start and out of oldness bringing newness
the ultimate act of identification and love

helper.identificatie: The Christ Child / The Mystery of Infancy
tekstueel_bewijs: He is the way to a new birth
He is empowered to say, 'Thy sins be forgiven'
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who acts through the Helper (Christ).

tegenstander.identificatie: The Mystery of Iniquity / Herod / Sin
tekstueel_bewijs: Satan goes forth to and fro
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described as a 'mystery' woven into the fiber of humanity, requiring 'war every day'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response to the mystery: fighting against social and personal sin.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / 'We'
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon moves from what God has done (Primary) to the obligation of the hearer to fight iniquity (Secondary).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has never given up on the world.
God has visited it in Jesus Christ.
God himself looked around... and said, 'It is good.'
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We must fight the war against sin.
We must make war every day.
We have no right to let the tinsel... blind us.

voorbeelden: Against the power of evil we must make war every day.
We must fight the war against sin.
The mystery baffles us but wins us.
I want my child to have a better chance.
knowing little of the theological terms, we feel God is near.
He is empowered to say, 'Thy sins be forgiven'.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'winsome' nature of the mystery to evoke desire (Vouloir) and then transitions to the obligation (Devoir) to fight sin.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from ~S1 (Oldness) to S1 (Newness), then acknowledges S2 (Iniquity) to warn against ~S2 (Tinsel-blindness).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in God's 'ultimate act of identification' which bridges the gap between time and eternity.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Sin is not a mistake but a 'mystery' and a 'loathsome word'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The deep structure identifies God as the primary actor who initiates the 'invasion.' While there is a strong moral imperative at the end, it is grounded in the prior action of God's arrival.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Against the power of evil we must make war every day.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Active Subject of Salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has never given up on the world... God has visited it.
Satan goes forth to and fro seeking whom he may devour.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The 'parents in hut and hovel' and the 'child in the nursery' are used as archetypes of hope, but Christ is not merely an example; He is the 'Way' and 'Empowered' one.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: The child in the nursery (as a type of new beginning)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Christ is the only one who can truly 'pull down the middle wall of partition,' which no human child can do.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Mystery of Infancy' to the 'Mystery of Iniquity' is logically sound, though the 'Mystery of Iniquity' section leans heavily on human effort.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God does his best' and 'iniquity arises' suggests a slight limitation on God's sovereignty.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God has come among men and women as one of them in the ultimate act of identification.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; sin is 'woven into the fiber and stuff of our humanity'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the 'Christmas Mystery' but shifts the Subject to 'We' when discussing the battle against sin.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The 'war against sin' is presented as a human performance (We must fight).
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Present the battle against sin as the Spirit of Christ acting through the believer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Because Christ has invaded our world, His light now fights the darkness within and among us.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the focus on the hearer as the beneficiary of the 'Invasion'.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: High Devoir (Must) in the second half.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (Power/Ability) derived from the Mystery.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that the 'New Creature' has the power to fight sin, not just the obligation.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already treats sin as a cosmic mystery (Satan/Herod).

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The ethical program (fighting sin) feels slightly detached from the soteriological program (the birth).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Explicitly link the 'New Birth' to the 'New Battle'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful, theocentric sermon that avoids the trap of 'cheap grace' by taking sin seriously, while keeping God as the primary actor in the Incarnation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'mystery' imagery; Greimas reveals that 'Mystery' functions as the Subject/Sender of change.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Lukan text; Greimas shows how the preacher uses the text to construct a narrative of 'Invasion'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals the 'Subject-switch' in the middle of the sermon where the hearer moves from a passive receiver to a warrior.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'Mystery' almost as a personified actant that performs the action of softening hearts.
